subject: Re: [junit] How to test a method that logs to a file
msgSnippet: Use the Dependency Injection pattern to inject your Logger into your class, and then use JMock or a similar mocking API to assert that the logger is called
messageBody:
Use the Dependency Injection pattern to inject your Logger into your class, and then use JMock or a similar mocking API
to assert that the logger is called with your expected parameters.

---
Stephen Smith, MEng (Wales).
http://www.stephen-smith.co.uk/

> I prefer to separate the notification of significant events from the logging
> (or other handling) of those events. It's easy to test the notification
> with mock objects and then wire the notifications into a logging system in
